intro: Ourisia coccinea var. minor, commonly known as the pink ourisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces showy, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
